item.title: Andrew add a quote by John Keats
item.description: "Beauty is truth, truth beauty,—that is all Ye know on earth, and all ye need to know" -- John Keats

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Groucho Marx
item.description: "Outside of a dog, a book is man's best friend. Inside of a dog it's too dark to read." -- Groucho Marx

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero

item.title: Andrew add a quote by William Shakespeare
item.description: "I think he would not wish himself anywhere but where he is." - Henry V, Act IV, scene i" -- William Shakespeare

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "Do what you can, with what you have, where you are." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Admiral Husband E. Kimmel and Vice Admiral William F. Halsey Jr.
item.description:
"Use your common sense."
"Now that's the best damn order I ever had." -- Admiral Husband E. Kimmel and Vice Admiral William F. Halsey Jr.

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Finish each day and be done with it. You have done what you could. Some blunders and absurdities no doubt crept in; forget them as soon as you can. Tomorrow is a new day. You shall begin it serenely and with too high a spirit to be encumbered with your old nonsense." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I have never let my schooling interfere with my education." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Theodore Roosevelt
item.description: "No man needs sympathy because he has to work, because he has a burden to carry. Far and away the best prize that life offers is the chance to work hard at work worth doing." -- Theodore Roosevelt

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Vice Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson 1st Viscount Nelson
item.description: "But in case signals can neither be seen or perfectly understood, no captain can do very wrong if he places his ship alongside that of the enemy." -- Vice Admiral Horatio Lord Nelson 1st Viscount Nelson

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Happiness consists more in the small conveniences of pleasures that occur every day, than in great pieces of good fortune that happen but seldom to a man in the course of his life." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Orson Welles
item.description: "You know what the fellow said – in Italy, for thirty years under the Borgias, they had warfare, terror, murder and bloodshed, but they produced Michelangelo, Leonardo da Vinci and the Renaissance. In Switzerland, they had brotherly love, they had five hundred years of democracy and peace – and what did that produce? The cuckoo clock." -- Orson Welles

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Jacques Barzun
item.description: "Teaching is not a lost art, but the regard for it is a lost tradition." -- Jacques Barzun

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Sheriff Heck Tate To Kill a Mockingbird 1962
item.description: "I may not be much, Mr. Finch, but I'm still sheriff of Maycomb County, and Bob Ewell fell on his knife." -- Sheriff Heck Tate To Kill a Mockingbird 1962

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Benjamin Franklin
item.description: "Either write something worth reading or do something worth writing." -- Benjamin Franklin

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Ransom Stoddard
item.description: "Education is the basis of law and order." -- Ransom Stoddard

item.title: Andrew add a quote by Apostle of Jesus Christ
item.description:
"And ye shall know the truth, and the truth shall set you free.
John 8:32" -- Apostle of Jesus Christ

item.title: Andrew add a quote by William James Durant
item.description: "One of the lessons of history is that nothing is often a good thing to do and always a clever thing to say." -- William James Durant
